property.name: llama.am.throttling.maximum.placed.reservations.root.default
property.description: Maximum number of reservations for #QUEUE# queue. Once this number of reservations is reached for the #QUEUE# queue, reservations are queued up. If this property is not set for the #QUEUE#, the global configuration property is used 'llama.am.throttling.maximum.placed.reservations'.

property.name: llama.am.throttling.maximum.queued.reservations.root.default
property.description: Maximum number of queued reservations for #QUEUE# queue. Once this number of reservations is reached for the #QUEUE# queue, new reservations are rejected. If this property is not set for the #QUEUE#, the global configuration property is used 'llama.am.throttling.maximum.queued.reservations'.

property.name: impala.admission-control.pool-default-query-options.root.default
property.description: read-1: Default Query Memory Limit to the exact amount of memory that Impala should set aside for queries in that pool. read-2: the default query options for all queries that run in this pool, For example, this is where you might set a default memory limit for all queries in the pool, using an argument such as MEM_LIMIT=5G.

property.name: impala.admission-control.pool-queue-timeout-ms.root.default
property.description: the timeout value for this pool in milliseconds.

property.name: impala.admission-control.max-query-mem-limit.root.default.regularPool
property.description: It gives Impala flexibility to set aside more memory to queries that are expected to be memory-hungry.

property.name: impala.admission-control.min-query-mem-limit.root.default.regularPool
property.description: It gives Impala flexibility to set aside more memory to queries that are expected to be memory-hungry.
